content.raw:
Quick note for context of why it was not done before:
I think it is valuable to have all the state machine logic / state transition management in the function that manages the competition. The functions `request_follow` etc were meant to be helper functions for competitor to interact easily with the ROS interfaces provided by the competition. Making the state an attribute and starting changing it in different functions makes the logic harder to follow and breaks the assumption that users can reuse any helper functions and drop-in replace the main function with their own logic (as the helper functions are not stateless anymore)
